title: The Wall Street Journal: James Bridenstine confirmed as NASA chief by slim margin in Senate
text:
WASHINGTON—James Bridenstine was narrowly confirmed to lead the nation’s space program Thursday, squeaking by in a Senate vote over unanimous opposition from Democrats who felt he lacked the necessary scientific background for the job of running the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.
Mr. Bridenstine, a House Republican from Oklahoma and former combat pilot, was nominated by President Donald Trump last fall, but his confirmation stalled over objections from members in both parties. The delay means he has lost opportunities...
